legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text:
SCOOP: Anthropic just released its most advanced AI model ever.

But in doing so, it may have quietly walked back one of its safety commitments — the kind of rule it once said would stop a release like this entirely. https://t.co/4mnoeKstXj

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

value.string_value: The company released a model it classified as risky — without meeting requirements it previously promised
Exclusive: Anthropic is Quietly Backpedalling on its Safety Commitments

legacy.full_text: More to say soon, but check out the full piece here: https://t.co/duf5EOWTT1

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text: Claude 4 Opus is the first Anthropic model to trigger AI safety level 3 protections after evaluators found it may help novices build bioweapons. Anthropic's chief scientist told TIME: "You could try to synthesize something like COVID or a more dangerous version of the flu."

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text: In 2023, Anthropic promised it wouldn't release an ASL-3 model until it had defined ASL-4 standards and evaluations. But the company's latest safety framework includes only brief definitions of ASL-4 and punts on evals — despite treating Claude 4 Opus as ASL-3.

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text: When I asked about this, Anthropic said the 2023 commitment was "outdated" and pointed to an October 2024 revision. The company now says it maps safety levels to increasingly stringent measures rather than requiring pre-defined future standards.

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text: But what does a voluntary commitment mean if a company can decide to change its terms? This reveals the core problem with AI self-regulation — companies are essentially policing themselves with no external enforcement.

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text: Anthropic told me that this change was approved by the company's Long Term Benefit Trust (LTBT), which appoints Anthropic's directors. This prompted me to look into how that was going, and it turns out the LTBT was supposed to have appointed 3 of 5 directors by now... https://t.co/5EeK0fe71l

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text:
but there are only 4 directors listed on Anthropic's website. 

In the absence of binding regulations, corporate governance ends up being really important. 

And now even the AI company most dedicated to safety is backpedaling on its commitments.

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text: This calls to mind a conversation I had in Feb 2024 with a senior safety researcher at a top AI company, who told me that voluntary governance works, until you get close to artificial general intelligence (AGI), at which point competitive pressures become too strong.

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text: A year and change later, those pressures appear to be winning. Insiders are making more concrete claims about the imminence of AGI. Meanwhile, safety practices at top companies appear to be suffering. https://t.co/rNBNIEijE4

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text:
Why does any of this matter? Well, Anthropic found that people with access to Claude 4 Opus were 2.5x more effective at acquiring a bioweapon than those with access to just the internet. 
https://t.co/Xx1HmNZ5X7 https://t.co/n1RkY3fbl1

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text: The depth of these evaluations and the decision to classify Claude 4 Opus as ASL-3 out of abundance of caution are commendable, and Anthropic appears to be behaving more responsibly than its peers.

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

legacy.full_text: But it also could have been more transparent about the changes it made to its past commitments — the very mutability of which really stretches the meaning of "commitment."

legacy.description: Omidyar Network - Reporter in Residence. Covers: @Jacobin, @TheNation Bylines: @NYTimes, @Nature, @BBC, @Guardian, @TIME, @Verge, @TRF, + others.
legacy.name: Garrison Lovely

value.string_value: Reporting and analysis on capitalism, great power competition, and the race to build machine superintelligence from journalist w/ work in NYT, Nature, BBC, TIME, and more. Click to read Obsolete, by...

legacy.full_text:
There's more in the full piece here: https://t.co/duf5EOWTT1

And if you enjoyed this, you should definitely subscribe to Obsolete, where I report on where capitalism, geopolitics, and AI collide. https://t.co/SACpFxQfkK
